snippet: Texans for Public Justice, criticized as a liberal attack machine, filed the complaints that led to the indictments of Tom DeLay, Rick Perry and Ken Paxton, the state attorney general.
abstract: Profile of Craig McDonald, founder of nonprofit government watchdog group Texans for Public Justice; McDonald has filed complaints that have led to felony indictments against former House Majority Leader Tom DeLay, former Texas Gov Rick Perry and Atty Gen Ken Paxton; McDonald remains modest about indictments, which he says were not politically motivated and represent only small portion of group's work in state.
lead_paragraph: Texans for Public Justice, criticized as a liberal attack machine, filed the complaints that led to the indictments of Tom DeLay, Rick Perry and Ken Paxton, the state attorney general.

headline.main: Texas Watchdog Group Calls Another Political Titan to Account
headline.print_headline: Low-Budget Watchdog Calls Another Texas Political Titan to Account
